name: tEQuitable
headline: tEQuitable's mission is to create work culture that works for everyone
description:
tEQuitable helps companies get in front of and prevent harassment. 
We are an independent, confidential platform to address issues of bias, discrimination, and harassment in the workplace.

For employees, we provide a sounding board they can consult without fear of retribution on issues ranging from subtle, insidious slights and invalidations to overt discrimination and harassment.

For companies, we provide data and insights to identify systemic issues, track behavioral trends, and develop actionable recommendations.

tEQuitable is using technology to make workplaces more equitable.

founders.name: Lisa Gelobter, Founder/CEO
founders.description:
Lisa has pioneered Internet technologies that have been used by billions of people, including Shockwave and Hulu. Most recently, she worked at the Obama White House, serving as the Chief Digital Service Officer for the Department of Education. Previously, Lisa acted as the Chief Digital Officer for BET Networks.

Lisa is one of Inc.'s 100 Women Building America's Most Innovative and Ambitious Businesses, Fast Company’s Most Creative People, is spotlighted in Eric Ries’ book “The Startup Way”.

#  Work culture that works for _everyone_. 
##  We are an independent, confidential platform to improve psychological safety, employee engagement, and uncover camouflaged issues before they escalate. 
[ Learn More ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/</get-more-info>)
## [What We Do](https://www.tEQuitable.com/</get-more-info>)
![Step 1: Empower Employees with alternative conflict resolution skills](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59c19d9c4c0dbf3555c0f484/1539818884378-EKSKOPDJKJ551JQ12IEJ/Step+1%3A+Empower+Employees+with+alternative+conflict+resolution+skills)
EmpowerEmployees
with a confidential, trusted channel to raise problems and get professional guidance
![Step 2: Quantify Systemic Issues of bias, discrimination, and harassment](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59c19d9c4c0dbf3555c0f484/1539818898471-FFFN7Z672D74G7D4SLBY/Step+2%3A+Quantify+Systemic+Issues+of+bias%2C+discrimination%2C+and+harassment)
QuantifySystemic Issues
ranging from subtle, insidious slights to severe, overt compliance concerns
![Step 3: Improve Workplace Culture to foster inclusion, belonging and equity](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/59c19d9c4c0dbf3555c0f484/1539818910846-4P3ITREULYNCLNRD98VM/Step+3%3A+Improve+Workplace+Culture+to+foster+inclusion%2C+belonging+and+equity)
ImproveWorkplace Culture
by providing effective prevention strategies and actionable recommendations
Trusted by industry-leading organizations
## How We Do It 
![Empower employees to address bias, discrimination, and harassment directly with co-workers or HR](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/iPhone-Mock2.png)
For the individual, a sounding board
Employees use a private digital platform and confidential calls with trained professionals to get advice and create an action plan that best fits their individual need
![Use data to drive culture improvements to increase inclusion, belonging, and equity](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/Laptop-Mock-2.png)
For the organization, data and insights
Aggregated data is used to track behavioral trends and identify opportunities to improve workplace culture that gives rise to unfair treatment
Establish a virtuous cycle to solve systemic work culture issues
[](https://www.tEQuitable.com/</s/Laptop-Mock-2.png>)
## A Proven Model 
Organizations utilizing informal conflict resolution approaches, such as Ombuds, report a 50-80% reduction in litigation. _The tEQuitable model is a modern Ombuds practice._
“The Organizational Ombudsman: Origins, Roles, and Operations: A Legal Guide” by Charles L. Howard 
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Build** trust in the organization
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Create** a healthier work culture
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Increase** productivity
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Promote** retention
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Improve** employee engagement
![Check](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/checkmark.png) **Reduce** risk of lawsuits
[ Speak with our team ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/</get-more-info>)
Featured In
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.nytimes.com/2018/03/23/us/sexual-harassment-workplace-response.html>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/hbr.org/2019/03/women-of-color-get-less-support-at-work-heres-how-managers-can-change-that>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.tequitable.com/lisa-gelobter-squack-alley-interview>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<http:/abc7news.com/worried-about-going-to-hr-there-is-an-app-for-that/3252829/>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.wsj.com/articles/sexual-harrassment-theres-an-app-to-report-that-1519228463>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.washingtonpost.com/news/on-leadership/wp/2018/01/05/sexual-harassment-inc-how-the-metoo-movement-is-sparking-a-wave-of-startups/>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/general-news/marti-noxon-how-tv-industry-can-better-protect-writers-next-toxic-showrunner-guest-column-1304789/>)
[ ](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.shrm.org/resourcesandtools/hr-topics/organizational-and-employee-development/pages/eeoc-wants-to-leverage-transformative-power-of-metoo-.aspx>)
## [Why We Do It](https://www.tEQuitable.com/<https:/www.tequitable.com/get-more-info>)
We envision a future where everyone can bring their whole, and best, selves to work. 
78%
of employees report experiencing some form of unfair behavior or treatment*
40%
of employees indicated that mistreatment played a major role in their decision to leave their company*
$16B
unfairness related turnover is a $16b a year problem*
*2017 Kapor Center for Social Impact “The 2017 Tech Leavers Study”
It's really important for an employee to open up and share things that might be happening to them at work, without attaching their name to it. What we get on the back end is data, not that says who said something, but around the teams and functions where we may have some issues. 
**LaFawn Davis** | Global Head of Culture and Inclusion ![Twilio logo](https://www.tEQuitable.com/s/twilio-logo-red.png)

generated_description:
tEQuitable is a forward-thinking company on a mission to create work cultures that truly serve everyone. Founded in 2017 and part of Y Combinator's Winter 2018 batch, this Oakland-based startup seeks to tackle the pervasive issues of bias, discrimination, and harassment in the workplace through a confidential and independent platform.

At its core, tEQuitable offers a safe space for employees to voice their concerns without fear of retaliation. Whether it’s addressing subtle slights or overt discrimination, their platform enables individuals to seek support and guidance, helping them navigate workplace complexities. On the company side, tEQuitable provides valuable data and insights that empower organizations to identify systemic problems and develop actionable strategies to foster a more inclusive environment.

With a small but dedicated team of six, tEQuitable combines technology and human insight to enhance psychological safety and employee engagement. The platform operates akin to an Ombuds service, leveraging informal conflict resolution methods which have been shown to dramatically reduce litigation rates for organizations.

What’s compelling about tEQuitable is its ambitious vision: a workplace where everyone can bring their whole selves without fear. Given that studies show a staggering 78% of employees experience some form of unfair treatment, the need for such an initiative is undeniable. 

In addition to their core services, tEQuitable offers myriad resources including blogs, webinars, and research papers to further educate and advocate for equitable practices in workplaces. Their work is backed by some industry-leading organizations, making it a trusted solution for many companies aiming to improve their workplace culture.

So if you’re looking to shift the dynamics in your organization towards a more equitable and inclusive environment, tEQuitable is a resource worth exploring. You can check them out at [tEQuitable.com](https://www.tEQuitable.com/).
